awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: International Workshop on "Survival  Analysis and Related Topics", June 1991
awd_abstract_narration: Survival analysis is a highly active area of research with                 applications spanning the physical, engineering, biological, and                social sciences.  Researchers in survival techniques, in addition               to statisticians and biostatisticians, include epidemiologists,                 reliability engineers, demographers and economists, who call this               area duration analysis.                                                              This grant will partially support an international workshop on             Survival Analysis and Related Topics, to be held in June, 1991 at               the Ohio State University.  Two distinct groups are doing research              in the area of Survival Analysis.  The reliability and life testing             group focuses on survival analysis for physical systems, primarily              from a parametric viewpoint.  The biostatistical group studies                  techniques for use in the biomedical sciences, and uses                         nonparametric or semiparametric methods.  The major goal of this                workshop is to provide a forum for an exchange of ideas between                 these groups, using the Bayesian approach, in order to develop an               environment for research leading to a synthesis of various ideas.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
